result.execSummary:
All charges against Levandior Cortez Conn in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Levandior Cortez Conn is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Levandior Cortez Conn

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Levandior Cortez Conn not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defendant has been federally indicted.  On State's motion, Court ordered case DISMISSED.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Levandior Cortez Conn not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state. Further, defense is requesting additional time to file a motion. Court grants request and sets 07/25/2022 deadline for filing any motions. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Michael J Steinle, appear in person.  Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 046097,
Payable Number: 1006474,
Receipt Number: 22RP019458,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Levandior Cortez Conn in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT WAS NOT INTERVIEWED FOR PUBLIC DEFEENER REPRESENTATION.  DEFENDANT STATES HE WILL HIRE PRIVATE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
